My omelette was perfectly prepared I also had jalapeños spinach and tomatoes. I had a very exotic brand of wheat toasted not sure what it was but it was fresh and tasty. Hashbrowns came out it in an usual circular presentation but they were perfect. Restroom small but clean. Many different seating options which I love the venue is very bright. Outdoor patio seating is complete with a ping-pong table and games. Parking is a little tough metered parking outside if you're lucky. Parking lot right next-door at the sign is hidden

We came after school let out for the semester and were told we came at a good time. Great atmosphere as it's cozy.  The food selection was great and they has different twists to the food. The Benny Goodman and the Snooze Classic were amazing and very filling.  If you haven't been here,  it's a must try!

I fell in love with Snooze as soon as it opened its Biltmore location, so I was over the moon when they came to Tempe! This location is just as good as its Phoenix sibling, and the wait was not as long. My group of five arrived at 9 am, and we were immediately seated. I guess all the college kids were still in bed. You snooze, you lose! LOL. The place had a considerable line by the time we left around 10:30 am. The menu is solid; pancakes, eggs benedict, and breakfast sandwiches that will blow your mind. This is my favorite morning restaurant, and I can't wait for the Gilbert spot to open!!!

Great place! Loved the overall aesthetics of the establishment as well as that of the food! Food came out promptly and was delicious! Staff is super friendly. The only concern we had was on of the desserts served a banana that still had the peel on it- which made my sister upset! 

Great meal overall!

It's a great place for kids if you didn't get up at the crack of dawn to avoid a wait. They have Foosball, ring toss, and ping pong outside. My kid literally didn't care that we waited about 20 minutes. The service was a little slow on the inside, but ok. They put some chives on their bacon. Fine for adults, but my kiddo flipped. Picking chives off bacon sucked. And it's so unusual to have bacon topped with anything I didn't even mention it. That said, I'd totally go again.
The service is awesome, Caitlin was the best! The corned beef was the best I have had anywhere in the USA! Add to that the great bloody Mary's!
no rush

Food was consistently delicious. We ordered two pancake flights and two duo Benny's. These are awesome ways to go -- you get to try more than amazing dish.

It was a great place to bring my autistic daughter. She enjoyed the rhythmic reggae and nobody in the place gave a second thought to her stereotype. Once we were in the booth, which provides good lighting but lots of seclusion, she was very happy. Servers were great with her.

What a cool place! It's modern with a twist!! We sat at the bar area and our service was exceptional!  Our server girl was so adorable and sweet, I regret not getting her name :( she was fun and bubbly while being attentive and on point the whole time. I hot the OMG french toast and a side of the hashbrowns. Best hashbrowns ever and the presentation was so cool! The French toast was yuuummmy!! It's a busy place, so expect a wait, but it's completely worth it!!

The pancake flight was very good! My favorite was the upside down cake. The chicken sausage and hash browns were good too. I had a panimoses which is basically a grapefruit version of mimosas it's was refreshing.  The mojito was good too! Great customer service. The whole family loved the place.

This place is the best! It's perfect in every way. Their food is delicious, unique, and fresh every time I have gone. Their staff is super friendly and inviting and prompt. The vibes of this place are great for any occasion, it's really open and has a great atmosphere, they offer beer too which is a plus! The only even remotely bad thing I could say is they are really slow about bringing you iced coffee haha. And you have to park in a parking garage but it is well worth the stop in. It's just as affordable as places like IHOP or Denny's too so why wouldn't you skip them and come here instead? They never mess up a meal either.

THE BEST GLUTEN FREE PANCAKE I'VE EVER HAD!

Oh my goodness, the large crowd and long wait time didn't matter. Their sweet potato pancake was so amazingly fluffy and flavorful. Kate, my server, was super friendly and brought everything on time.

It was a great experience, I'll be back!
Some of the best pancakes I've ever had! Service is a bit slow sometimes but overall a must every time I'm in Phoenix.

Last day in Tempe and needed some breakfast before boarding the flight.  Stopped by snooze at about 845.   Place was packed so i figured the food was going to be great!   There were no seats left so we sat at the bar.  I ordered corned beef hash with eggs over hard, toast and coffee while my friend ordered french toast and juice.   The coffee came quickly but it was freezing cold outside so i drank the coffee as quickly as it was poured.  They never offered to refill my coffee.  The food finally came out.  The toast was warm and thick and covered in butter.   The eggs that i had asked overhard came out almost over done and scrambled.  The corned beef hash was almost non existent.  It was barly a spoonful.  Although the food did taste good, it was not what i expected.

Ooo. M. G. Pancake flight and Steak& eggs benedict. Everything was to die for!  I mean literally I thought I died and went to Breakfast Heaven! Whoa!  Perfect combination for Hubby and I to share!  Definitely needed the hiking and Bike ride to burn it off though! Totally worth it!! 
We sat outside and they have LOTS of misters and a big patio complete with a ping pong table which was fun. The vibe is fun and modern with bright happy colors and open spacious feel.  One of our new favorite spots!!

I went in today with my friend for a late breakfast and it was so amazing!! I got the ham Benedict III and my friend got the breakfast pot pie and they were both amazingly delicious. Our server (can't remember her name but we were on the patio around 12 if that helps!) was fantastic. She brought me a hot toddy and it was presented in the cutest way I have ever seen. I can't wait to come back :)

I love this eatery! It has a fantastic vibe!!! The food is fabulous!!! The staff is fantastic!!! My only complaint is the occasional wait, but they are pretty good about turning over tables quickly, and you can always get Bartop service. Try the bacon Bloody Mary you won't regret it!!!

It just happens that we've eaten here twice in the last month or so, and I have to say that we love this place. The vibe is quintessential college-town hip, and the food is fresh and delicious, made with care and quality ingredients. The service has been very good, with a large staff that is always eager to please. Our breakfast choices have been shrimp & grits, corned beef hash & eggs, a breakfast burrito, and huevos rancheros. Every one has been excellent. If we're ever in the area again, this is our go to spot for breakfast.

The food is pretty good, nothing too special. It's very expensive honestly, but it has a nice atmosphere and it's something new for Tempe. I would recommend the pancake flight, which is three mini pancakes of all their pancake choices, so it's a great way to try new things!
pancake of the day

Really cool retro ski cabin feel. I dig it! Great location. They have a corn hole game on the patio, nice touch. The most decadent pancakes!!! 

Now I'm vegan and unfortunately their Veg options are pretty sad. Tofu scramble consists of big plate of whisked tofu (unseasoned or sauces) and a sprinkle of cooked veggies with toast :( 

Hopefully they update their menu to offer more Veg friendly options soon. Miss that place.
I am sure the food is good had we got a chance to eat there. What was supposed to be a 20 minute wait turned into almost an hour. Had to leave to find abother place.

I had never been to Phoenix before and I tried Snooze for breakfast. A great menu with vegetarian options. Outdoor seating, trendy atmosphere near college. Service was friendly, food great and the special mimosa hit the spot !
Super yummy!! Great food, service, and environment.

Looked it up on yelp decided to check it out. Cool
Place for it being so trendy. Food was great so was the service

Cool place in the heart of Tempe....a modern retro cafe that blew my socks off! It was packed on a Friday morning so we sat at the bar and got great service! My boyfriend had the Snooze Classic with chicken sausage and it was really flavorful. I ordered the Duo Benny's, one chili Verde and one chilaquiles. AMAZING! I have been raving about it for 2 days now! Our server also had a molten chocolate lava with pomegranate pancake brought out for us to try....so rich and so awesome! I'd pair that with a bottle of red wine! Would LOVE to go back!

The first Snooze I went to was in San Diego earlier this year. That place was straight. The food, the drinks, the atmosphere and the service was all top notch, 5 star stellar. This one? Not so much. The food taste-wise was a 4 and the portion of my homemade hash was kinda sorry. I left still a little hungry. Adult beverages were a 4 as well, despite the Michelada my Honey got being just a little watery. While the staff weren't downright rude, they're college kids (to be expected) with impatient attitudes and obviously fake sentiment. I can deal with that. I think the main reason I'm giving this one a 3 star is because of the absolutely obnoxious music that was being played. For Sunday brunch, I really DO NOT want to listen to Dubstep, Techno (or anything even closely related) or your favorite shitty rapper talking about all his latest sexual conquests. I hate country music but I would've taken that over the noise that was coming out of the speakers while I was there. I'll probably give this place another try but I've had better luck the past few times I went to Postino's in Phoenix. Maybe I'll try the Postino's next door instead.
This is hands down delicious every time.  Their eggs Benedict is amazing, and the coffee and cocktails are smooth and tasty.

So disappointed in our experience at Snooze today! About halfway through eating my Bella Bella Benny, I found a hair. I alerted the server and she took it away immediately and said they would make me a new one. This was the chance for Snooze to shine, but nope. No manager ever came to our table to acknowledge the issue and guess what? They charged me for the dish!! 

Sorry Snooze -- I was hoping for so much more from you! 

Update: I heard from the business manager at Snooze right shortly after posting this. My faith in Snooze has been restored! I know mistakes happen but I am so pleased that this one has been handled as well as it has been. Thank you, Becky, for reaching out!  Snooze will have us as customers again soon.

Pineapple upside down pancake was amazing!  The wait was a little long, but the food was so worth it!  Went there for a meet and greet between my boyfriend/mom.  We each had something different, but loved every bite!  My mom happened to mention how great the pancake would be, and the waitress brought us one on her!  Would recommend to anyone who enjoys good breakfast/brunch!

This place was great!  From the moment we put our name  in (they text you when table is ready) to the time we left we had a great experience!  Their French toast was to die for! We also tried the quevos rancheros and it was amazing too.  Great service too!

My first visit I ordered the breakfast tacos and they were delicious. My second trip I ordered the breakfast burrito and the green chili had a little spice. I had added ham with the burrito and it was most pleasing. 

Their americanos are pretty good. However,  I cannot say the same about the coffee pancakes. Otherwise, great service and great food.

I have mixed feelings about snooze. The first time I went there was a 45 minute wait, but hey it was a busy Saturday morning and I was okay with that and the food was good and I overall had a good experience, the food was tasty, however then I went today (2/16/15) and it was a 15 minute wait, and then when I went in the hostess at the front said her partner would be back to seat us in a moment. After she said that, a new party came in and then the lady who came to seat us despite being told there are two parties only took the group that came in after us. When she returned another group had come in and the lady began prepping for that party to be seated (again ignoring us) and when the other person in my party asked about that she said in a snippy, rude tone

(she hadn't, we'd been waiting after having received the message that our table was ready for about 5-10 minutes) and then seated the second party to arrive after us. Then a different person took us to our table, finally. Ultimately, that woman (working at 10:30, who was seating people) was incredibly rude, and the experience was awful and we ended up leaving because that one person gave me such a horrible time. I truly hope this was an isolated experience and that she will learn some people skills. It's really sad because I had such a good experience the first time. We left and went to ncounter and enjoyed the rest of our day.

Amazing buttermilk pineapple upside down pancakes with cinnamon butter.  Unique and delicious. Fun, bright orange and airy ambience at the new edge of the Tempe ASU campus.  Serves a variety of interesting bloody Mary's if so inclined including fresh gazpacho. Ordered the Benny Goodman eggs Benedict with salmon locks.  Scrumptious!  Fresh squeezed OJ too.  Big crowds, but move fast and will text you when table is ready.  Can hang out for free coffee while waiting or enjoy a nice stroll if the nearby ASU campus.

If you take away one thing from this review let it be: PANCAKES.

Inside the restaurant the music is extremely loud plus the abundance of chatter makes it very difficult to hear your brunch mates. Perhaps that makes me sound old, but I don't get to see these guys all the time so when I do I'd like to be able to converse with them. 

Sitting outside isn't really much of an option in the summer either. There didn't appear to be much shade or misters to try to beat the heat so unless you enjoy becoming a melted burnt mess inside you go.

The service was alright, but the servers definitely seem overwhelmed with the crowd of people. We barely saw the poor thing who was busy running around. Did I mention the place was slam packed? 'Cause it was. That being said the wait time to get in was only about 20 mins.
 
I wasn't overly impressed with the food I ordered. My potatoes were not crisp. (I like my hash browns to have a crispy seer.) Also, there were some gross soggy pieces of bacon fat in my dish. I took the most of it home and reheated it in a skillet with some butter and that did turn out delicious. 

The pancakes are where it is at though! We split a pancake flight and I have to say all 3 different kinds were fantastic! They were light and fluffy and full of flavor. They each were so good individually I don't think I could even pick one favorite of the bunch. I highly recommend trying the ones we had: Strawberry Fields, Blueberry Danish and Peanut Butter Cup. I have a feeling the rest of the pancakes and the french toast are probably equally was tasty as well. 

Oh yeah, did I mention the pancakes? Get the pancakes!!

Everything was amazing. Food, service, etc. wait was long, but so worth it. 

Recommend French toast or scramble. I'll be back next time in Phoenix

Excellent service and food! Awesome atmosphere. Great for gluten dietary restrictions and very knowledgeable about cross-contamination. My Celiac daughter had the gluten free kids' French toast and loved it. They also have her a GF chocolate chip pancake to sample. Excellent find!

I've only been to Snooze early on weekdays as to avoid crowds so I can't complain about wait times and spotty service. I've had both the corned beef hash and Chile Verde eggs Benedict. Both were delicious. I tend to choose savory options, but will have to try their pancakes a French toast in the future.

Eggs Benedict - salsa verde is untouchable.  Wow so freaking delicious.  I seriously day dream about this stuff.  I don't know how to explain it other then you won't be disappointed.  It has so much flavor and every bite will take you closer to heaven.
Every time I go, I am always pleased. Delicious food, great service.

Best breakfast in Tempe! I have probably been here about 4 times since it opened and it's now my go to breakfast spot in Tempe.

The decor is so fresh and cute but also inviting. Every time I've been the servers are great and always able to give suggestions. I have had all of the eggs Benedict but my absolute favorite is the chiliquiles benedict! It's eggs benedict with salsa, barbacoa, and a stack of tortillas instead of an English muffin. Seriously delicious! If you can't decide which eggs Benedict you want you can do half and half.

Speaking of half and half, my boyfriend was deciding between 2 different french toasts and our server said he could do half of each. They seriously go above and beyond to make their customers happy and encourage customization. 

Next time you need a breakfast close to ASU or you want to show off Tempe to out of towners, come here!

I've heard about this place. I always wanted to check it out, so today was the day. My Son & I came for brunch there was a 20 min wait but 2 seats at the bar was available and we were able to sit there. Which is great he got to watch teen titans go on the tv. He had the blueberry pancake with hash browns, fruit and lemonade. I had the OMG! French Toast with a raspberry sprite. Once I tasted the hash browns I had to have some too. The food was delicious and worth the amount and the staff was friendly and very social with us. The only downside is ASU parking next time we will take the light rail.

Really good, high quality food. It is one of my favorite spots for breakfast! I have been here a few times and they never disappoint. The ambience of the restaurant is very hip and open. Others too like this place, so there usually is a long wait on the weekends-we went on a Monday afternoon and there was no wait and plenty of space for our big party. 

I had the Breakfast pot pie, with a side of hashbrowns. Everything on the plate was delicious, it is a dish I have not seen anywhere else. If you haven't been here or are a regular, it is something to try on their menu. The portions seemed rather hearty, so come hungry; if not, sharing is always an option.!

This is easily one of the best breakfast places and food establishments I've ever been to. It's so modern and stylish. Great service and extremely good food. I cannot wait to go back to AZ to eat here!

YOU MUST GO! Diverse menu, amazing coffee and wonderful portion sizes.  My friend and I ordered the Breakfast tacos and the French toast and split them. Both were great. Also, sit on the patio if you can.  The weather + the view of the campus and its surroundings are wonderful.
Love the pancakes. Definitely encourage the three pancakes options, don't miss the sweet potatoes and pineapple ones. Amazing.

Long wait but boy is it worth it. The service was perfect, the food left my boyfriend and I craving it for weeks. First time we sat on the patio and enjoyed the weather. Perfect spot for a mimosa or bloody Mary and brunch. Second time we waited for an hour and sat near the bathrooms, which awkwardly enough have a bit of a view to the men's room.
Cool

Today my boyfriend and I split the corned beef hash and a pancake flight. Hash was delicious, just a little greasy and I wish there were more hash browns in the mix. Pancake flight was fun, and there are so many unique flavors! We got the peanut butter cup, bourbon pumpkin, and sweet potato. Sweet potato was to die for, light and moist with just a hint of sweetness - perfect. Pumpkin was also great with a tasty glaze. The chocolate pb one was just too sweet for me; delicious but I am just not a big fan of super sweet breakfasts. All around tasty breakfast with reasonable prices and unique menu items.

My hubby, daughter and I enjoyed a lovely brunch at Snooze yesterday. We are excited for them to open in Scottsdale, near where we live. I must say the art deco, bright ambiance gives the proper anticipation of a fun meal. I started with an MMMmmm Mimosa which was light and lovely. Carlene, our server, made the entire experience excellent. She even had a whimsical bacon and egg hair clip that she made. Shows you right off the bat, she loves her work. Since it was our first visit she brought us (on her) the pineapple upside down pancake with cinnamon butter. I don't even like sweets, but it was DIVINE! We all scooped it up. Our sweet daughter had the tomato soup and grilled cheese, which she loved. The soup almost tasted like a marinara. Very fresh and delicious. I had the lox, rye, capers, herbed goat cheese, and arugula plate. It was very good. My husband had the corned beef hash. It came out cold and they immediately retired it and made it right. The manager( forgot his name- glasses and a ponytail) did a great job of assuring that it would be perfect the next time. 

All in all, we are not going to want to wait until the end of August when Kierland opens so we will be back. BRAVO! Laurie and Rodney Malone
This place is lit. I got the Mexican Benedict and it was amazing! French toasts was really good as well! Avoid going on Sunday's if you want to be served faster

My husband and I went here for brunch on a Friday. Full of ASU kids, naturally, but the staff was incredibly friendly and attentive. Awesome food (french toast and Candy Apple pancakes) including THE best bacon I have ever had. We will absolutely go again.
My favorite place for breakfast in Tempe this place rocks the Benedicts are freaking awesome and the coffee and pancakes top it off
This is a must!  Fun breakfast place on ASU campus Tempe AZ.  Corn Beef Hash was great with poached eggs.  Also Snooze Continental with Grapefruit Brûlée - Nice!
Really great mimosas, blueberry danish pancakes, and chocolate chip pancakes! Service was good but not amazing. Would come back though!

I was looking for a good breakfast. I was over the hotel continental breakfast. Looked up Yelp and my yelp peeps didn't let me down. 

Atmosphere is casual, easy and fun. 
Service is smart (literally reading my mind), fast and on point. 
Food is incredibly GOOD! I went for the french toast neat with a side of bacon. My coffee was the best I've EVER had. Seriously, EVER! This place did not disappoint. You owe it to yourself to have a phenomenal breakfast at Snooze.

Awesome breakfast/brunch place. This restaurant concept is really picking up in the Tempe-Scottsdale region with every place offering something a little unique and different. My favorite thing on the menu at Snooze is Juan's breakfast tacos. Three tacos with sturdy tortillas that don't crumble after the first bite. 

The atmosphere is so relaxed and fun. They have yard games to play while waiting for a table or if you'd like to hangout and drink mimosas all morning. 

Plan ahead if you are coming on a weekend. They don't take reservations as is the standard in Tempe; and the wait can get up over 2 hours! Have patience because the food will be worth the wait!

Stylish and eclectic atmosphere with really yummy breakfast food! Staff is nice and attentive, very good place for breakfast or brunch. This particular location can get kind of crowded and difficult to get to though because the college is so close. Also, you have to pay for parking and may have a walk a distance. However, it's close to a parking garage (still have to pay and walk, but it's covered!). Recommended for a brunch once in a while!

BEST breakfast place ever, I will spend my last dollars on their Bella! Bella! Benny! any day. Everything is so flavorful and the staff is always so nice and in a good mood, absolutely love this place.
This has become my favorite breakfast spot. The Chile verde Benedict is absolutely delicious I just can't get enough of this place. The wait staff is super friendly l.

Awesome place for breakfast!  I had The best pancake ever...blueberry Danish.  I could eat that every day!  

The atmosphere was fun with great retro music. staff wad fantastic, friendly & quick. You have to try it to see it.

One pancake will feed 2 people. 
Super creative menu and a bunch of happy college kids eager to stuff your face with delicious bacon and eggs. 
Their morning booze game is fantastic.  I mean someone seriously went out of their way to make sure your hair of the dog tastes good. I'd suggest you get their early and sit outside before that Tempe heat gets you. 
Love this place.

Have been here a few times, as usual the place was busy, which is a good sign in my books. The food is and was excellent, had a three egg omelette with beef, spinach and mushrooms, sourdough toast with blackberry jam and a hash brown. I tried one of their coffee cocktails, the dirty drunken chai. All fantastic. The only issue with the place was the service, poor would be an upgrade on what we got.
Excellent service, great food and prompt! Morgan was awesome, pleasant and accommodating. Next time I'm in Tempe, I'll be back.

I leave Snooze with few regrets and with much to celebrate. I've been here three times now, trying different dishes each time, including the spuds deluxe, shrimp and grits, chili verde benedict, corned beef hash, and many of the pancakes. Each meal has been utterly transcendental. But my favorite are the breakfast tacos, with corned beef.

This place is great for breakfast! Staff is very friendly, they are fast at getting food out. Definitely want to come early because they get packed fast! Ordered the eggs Benedict and it was delicious! Also ordered the Ruben sandwich and it was great too!

Holy deliciousness. I came here for the breakfast pot pie, and was sold on the pancakes and cocktails. Let me back up... the breakfast pot pie was good, but I wouldn't say it was 'great'. There was nothing wrong with it, it just had a few spices that don't match my tastes. Loved that it was in a puff pastry though, and that you get to choose the type of egg you want on top! Also, major bonus points at Snooze for being able to swap out different sides to customize your dish without it impacting the price- probably the best part about Snooze as a whole. I really wanted corned beef hash (which was A-MAZING) so I subbed out the regular hash browns for that instead.

Anyways, THE PANCAKES. I got a single blueberry danish pancake as a side to my pot pie, and oh my gosh I wish I had gotten a full stack. Normally, when you get sweetly flavored pancakes, they are super, supppppper sweet - you can hardly taste the pancake underneath. This was not the case at all at Snooze. This was the fluffiest, tastiest buttermilk pancake with a delicious light and sweet lemon cream cheese filling. The streusel, sweet cream, and blueberry topping are lightly drizzled over the top. No overkill at all - the perfect light enhancement to the delicious buttermilk of the pancake.

For beverage, if you don't get the mountain mule, you are severely missing out. This might have been the best breakfast cocktail I've ever had in my life, and I'm a big fan of brunch, so thats saying A LOT.

I will DEFINITELY be making Snooze a regular in my brunch rotation... I may even go back next weekend.

We have been trying to come, being ASU territory it tends to be busy. Decided to come early, well worth it. The sandwich I am is mouth watering good, soft pretzel bun was perfect. My partner got the eggs Benedict, beyond pleased. Will be returning for another adventure in good eating.
Delicious, fresh breakfast foods. Food came out just as ordered for our party of six, and quickly. The unique takes on breakfast aren't too

so I like it. They definitely boast a different menu of the classics without adding fresh mountain alpine arugula or southeastern Cuban coast seaweed to every dish. (Refreshing in a time where people are trying to hard sometimes.) 

Atmosphere is very fun and friendly. We experienced a theme day the Sunday we went. It was beach day so the servers were wearing floaties and sunscreen noses. Very nice touch. 

Service was phenomenal. Very good team effort/vibe, coupled with quick, attentive service and thorough but timely check backs from our server. It was a small 10 minute wait but this was the off college season. Throw in free weekend covered structure parking right next door and it's well worth it.
I got yogurt with granola and it was delicious. I'm going to go here more often. The avocado and toast on the side was great too!
Amazing! The pancake of the day was so good we ordered again before leaving. I was so impressed.

I didn't use any salt, pepper or hot sauce on anything, it was all that delicious. With their intriguing and diverse menu, not to mention the paradoxical vintage yet modern ambiance, I'll be eating at Snooze a lot more often.

Writing this review as we sit waiting for the past 15 minutes on our server to take our order,after waiting 35 minutes to be seated. Under the table is a crayon and crushed Pringles from who knows when. On top of that they put us at a table underneath a planter swarming with flies and bees, needless to say I have done the landscaping for them. Will update this post after The meal if the food happens to be better than the service, which is what we have heard. Way to treat a new patron, will not recommend or be back.

Snooze delivers a superb breakfast experience. I went here originally in Boulder, and when I came to Phoenix I was really happy that they also had Snooze. It is a great place. The first time, I got a benny duo with the traditional (dat hollandaise was amazing) and the verde pulled pork (also gr8). The second time, I got the pancake flight. There was a sweet potato pancake which was not my thing but the blueberry danish pancake was amazing and delicious and next time, I am getting just that probably. The menu is diverse and great and expensive but I think brunch is worth spending big bucks on so I recommend it to all my fellow brunch lovers.

This place is soooo yummy! I have been here twice and have not been disappointed. You really can't get anything wrong on the menu. The drinks are delicious too. The service is great along with the atmosphere!
The perfect breakfast place with an amazing staff and the food comes out quick!! The Harvest Benny is the business.

Hands down our favorite place! Fantastic food , tons of options but I do love the breakfast burritos! Such a great energy there and awesome staff . We also love it because we can enjoy our weekend with our four legged children

The décor in this restaurant was so cute; it was very retro.  The breakfast menu was extensive making it hard to make a decision. We ended up with the breakfast burrito (very good, the green chili made it) and the homemade granola (awesome) along with 1 flight sized pineapple upside down pancake, which was the best pancake I have every had!  I also like the option to get a flight of pancakes to try all of their wonderful varieties.  The coffee was also very good and our server was very friendly and helpful.  I cannot wait to visit AZ and hit this place up again!
A breakfast must.. Bella Bella won't disappoint.
offers a create your own 3 pancake choice. I recommend OMG French toast, Pinapple upside down and the sweet potato or the daily special. Coffee is great and so much more...

Had a good first experience here We had called over weekend and been old there was an hour wait On tues we got seated immediately The hollandaise was very good and the filling in the Danish pancakes was great Bloody Mary was a lil weak but I'll def be back to try more food
First time here! The service was great and the food was fantastic. We'll definitely be back

I had the snooze classic with the chicken sausage, my love had the duo bennys, one chili verde and one chilaquiles. Totally awesome! Great service and the place was packed! Add in the complimentary molten chocolate lava pancake. this place is a must stop!
Great breakfast spot. There is a wait for a reason. Server was attentive, friendly and fun. Food was incredible. I had the egg white scramble with wheat toast and hash browns. Highly recommend!

Lovely place with cool, retro decor, good size patio.  All staff we encountered were quite friendly, as was the GM who stopped by the table more than once.  Great menu options with a combo of traditional favorites with a twist for more modern options.  I had the OMG French toast which was amazing.  AM cocktails looked delicious, but I opted for an iced tea.  
The only issue we had was navigating my friend's stroller...but it is a HUGE double stroller, so not really an issue.

Will definitely be back for more!

Complimentary coffee whole you wait. Excellent breakfast whole family had a lot of fun. 

A bit pricey but not expensive. Service was really good even on a busy holiday weekend
Random Yelp pick while on the road... Did not disappoint! Latté was average but food and service were amazing!
Never been here and didn't gush about all the food. Shrimp and Grits is out now now and it was like I was in NOLA. Normally place skimp on the spice on this dish but as expected Snooze doesn't.

My husband and I came down to Tempe for a weekend to have fun and meet up with his college roommate.  His roommate took us here (he always takes us the best places) when we said we wanted breakfast.  We had a nice walk from our hotel and only a short wait to get a table.  The place was hoppin'.  We ate on the patio, which was perfect as it was a beautiful day.  Our server was peppy and attentive.  They were doing a 50s beach/surfer theme, so staff was all dressed in character.  

I ordered the Snooze breakfast burrito and a mimosa.  It was very flavorful and I liked that it was black beans instead of refried.  My husband got the corned beef hash breakfast and was equally impressed.  It was very hard to choose what I wanted to eat because there are so many options.  They have a breakfast pot pie that looks sinful.  There are all kinds of breakfast sammies and they have pancake platters if you want to try different flavors.

I would love to eat here again on our next Tempe trip.

I had my first experience with Snooze when I was in Denver last year so was thrilled to see that there were several in the Phoenix area on a recent trip! 

And, seeing as how I won't get my fix until my next trip out west in May, I made the most of it with a pancake flight (blueberry Danish, pineapple upside down cake and molten chocolate lava).  Seriously the best gluten free pancakes EVER and the pineapple upside down was hands down the favorite.

Also, I love that they have gluten free toast for the benedicts, and that you can mix and match.  I got the Bella Benny and one with lox.  Perfectly seasoned everything, and my only regret is again, that there isn't one in my hometown.

If you don't have a Snooze near you, you owe it to yourself to make a trip when you find one near!

There is no reason to go to snooze when ncounter is within walking distance. The quality isn't terrible, but the prices make it seem like snooze thinks they invented breakfast. 

The hollandaise sauce was thick, almost the consistency of nacho cheese you'd left sitting for a bit too long, and lacked the familiar spice or lemon zing you'd expect. 

Snooze: ham Benedict (English muffin, ham, egg, hollandaise, shredded hash brown) 10.50; $13 out the door 

Ncounter: farmers market eggs Benedict (English muffin, ham, avocado, sautéed spinach, tomato, egg, hollandaise, country style hash browns) 7.50, side of fruit (pineapple, grapes, cantaloupe, honeydew, watermelon, oranges) 3. $13 out the door

Amazing place, food will not disappoint!!! Pancakes are fabulous!!! Every flavor you can imagine!!!! There shouldn't be one bad review, discard those. Oh and if want mimosa or any other coffee liqueur drink they have it!!!!

Fabulous brunch place!! I love the sweet stuff on the menu. The specialty pancakes are amazing!

There is parking available in the asu Fulton garage if you can't find a meter.

Have been to snooze two times and each visit has not been far from impressive.  I have been a server for nine years so I try to be very understanding of the potential for things to go wrong within the restaurant, but a good attentive server whom is apologetic when things do go wrong can save a bad visit.  Each time I have been to snooze the servers are far from accommodating and unfriendly.  Today my friend and I came into eat and the visit started as an average experience.  We ordered quickly and the bartender was prompt.  Our food however took along time to come out, about 25-30 minutes and when it arrived both plates of good were very cold.  It took us about five minutes to track down a different employee to send it back. While we waited for our plates to be remade we were not offered refills on empty drinks or offered another bar drink. The plates than took another 20 minutes to be remade.  I was appreciative that the manager came and apologized and offered to take care of our entrees.  When one of the bartenders came and dropped the tab she said well as the meals were taken care of so hope that made you happy.  It was a very snide and rude remark and first of all we didn't want the meal comped.  We wanted hot food and in a timely fashion. Needless to say after her comment I will no longer return to snooze. I can make a better, more pleasant breakfast at home and I would rather give my business to a more pleasant and deserving staff.

As a few other reviewers have noted, this place is extremely overhyped.

I was super excited to try it and was disappointed both with the food and the service. They told us the wait would be 30 minutes, we waited over double this. It took over an hour.
The thing that particularly frustrated me is that toward the end of my wait, I watched two people just waltz in in front of us. Apparently they had some open bar seating available that was first come first serve, and no one mentioned to us that this was an option.

By the time I got to my seat I was a little annoyed, but the menu looked good and after the wait I really wanted to enjoy myself. The server took our order, and literally never came back. Someone else brought out the food, and we practically had to beg the guy to take our money since he had evidently forgot we were there.

To add fuel to the fire, neither of our meals were good. I wouldn't say it was awful, but it definitely wasn't anything worth going back for. The food was plain and cooked poorly. I was really disappointed in the entire experience and won't be going back.

Service was superb - and sitting on the patio in a warm spring morning was nothing short of inspiring.  

I ordered the Snooze Spuds Deluxe with the green chili.  Everyone at the table ordered something different - i apologize profusely I don't remember their orders - but I do remember mine - very very very (did I say Very?!) good!  Wow - great combination of flavors, perfectly cooked, spiced just right, and the right amount to fill a big boy like me without overdoing it.

Server was there just enough to take care of us and ensure drinks were filled and any needs taken care of.  

I'll be back.

This place has the best breakfast burrito of ALL TIME. Service was on point, I think my servers name was Nick. That dude had great recommenfations was attentive and super friendly. 
Props to this place and it's workers, will definitely be back soon.
The meatless eggs Benedict (Late Harvest Benny) is very disappointing and was probably the worst
eggs Benedict I've ever had. The pancake flight (pick three different pancake flavors) was pretty good, nothing amazing though. Don't know if I'll be back.

Snooze is a great brunch option for unique sweet options and classic savory. The sweet potato pancakes were delicious without the flavor being too strong. The Bella Benny had a great creamy hollandaise sauce, and the prosciutto was cooked perfectly. The ambiance of the restaurant was great, fairly packed with attentive service.
Simply fantastic. Try the soyrizo omelet with mushrooms, avocado and cheddar. You won't be disappointed.

Probably the best breakfast I have had in awhile! Was so amazing I wish I could make you taste it while reading this review. I got the snooze classic and my man got the steak & eggs benny! They both were perfection! Our server was amazing as well, very down to earth and super nice. We will definitely be back. I honestly do not know how anyone could rate this place any less than 5 stars. We are impressed!
Customer service was outstanding! Food was excellent and loved the friendliness of Snooze.  Was our first time here, would definitely recommend and come back!

The food was just amazing.  Everything was fresh and tasty.  The coffee was top notch.  Our server was friendly, prompt, and courteous.  I can't believe this was the first time there and we cannot wait to go back.  They allowed us to split a breakfast meal and even put it on separate plates for us.  We each had a different Benedict and I will say the Elote Benedict is as incredible as it it unique.  We split a pineapple upside down pancake for dessert and loved every bite.

It was my first time eating brunch at Snooze, and I got to say... it was great! The pancakes are very good. Since it was my first time, the waiter sent out a free pancake, to taste. The sweet potato pancakes are awesome paired with a spicy Bloody Mary. The service is great and will definitely be coming back.

Had brunch today! Was delicious from Bloody Mary to the B.E.A.T sandwich. Service was excellent!! Bobbi was polite and very friendly. There was a brief down pour; which being from Oregon wasn't a real issue but Bobbi insisted on opening an umbrella to keep my party dry.... Thank you Snooze for a wonderful experience...

Heard this place had a best French Toast so I've ordered Just a French Toast Neat with a pouched egg and sausages on the side. The food would have tasted better if they were served hot. I've saw more employees than the customers but still my food was served cold. So disappointed!!!
Food was so so bland and tasteless. But location is great, inside is great, staff is great. But food sucked. I think this place is more trendy then delicious.
Simply an awesome breakfast experience. Gloria and the team impressed with perfect individually cooked eggs over medium and a smile.

Hands down, my favorite breakfast spot. 
When you walk in you will notice a fun light atmosphere. The decor is bright and clean, the staff is friendly and appears to really enjoy their job. The menu has enough selection without being overwhelming. The dishes are all vegetarian, you can add meats for a small additional charge. 
The alcoholic beverages are really good and refreshing.  He juice and coffee is fresh. There's nothing on that menu that doesn't taste good. 
As of amazing food isn't enough, the awesome staff makes the visit worth it.

Located next to the Fulton center Parking, they serve solid breakfast here. Came here after the race day 2 during RNR AZ marathon as I parked at the Fulton parking in the morning. Walking back from Tempe park, I wanted to stop for breakfast sooner but I didn't have money with me, I had to go back to my car first to get my credit card. Conveniently located next to where I parked, this restaurant was perfect as I didn't have to walk anymore.

Initially I was told 20 mins wait, but they have some seats available with bar height chairs, I was told they were first come first served. Shortly after I sat down, friendly server came to take an order. She was extremely busy but her service was prompt. 

Food is excellent. We had pinnacle upside down pancake and ham Benedict, both tasted very good, solid breakfast.  Porched egg was cooked perfect, good sauce, I also enjoyed their hash browns. Good textures.  Good portion size, definitely hit the spot after running.

Parking was free for runners when I arrived at 6:30am but notice they charge $5 for special event when I came back. Not sure how much is parking normally.

I always thought Tempe is just a college town and never ventured out here but now I know, I would like to explore this area more.

Went there last week for the first time
And I have to admit the service was not as good as I expected. My girlfriend and I waited for almost 30 mins for our food to come out. When the food did actually come out, it was already cold so we asked for it to be heated up again. The food was decent, but the fact that we had to wait for another 15 mins longer to get a nice heated brunch was quite unreasonable. I'd probably go back one day to give it another try, but not any time soon.
Came back and was super happy all the way around. Perfect eggs, great service, and smiles.

Snooze was just what the Dr. ordered. Good food, good drinks and friendly staff. 

This was my first time visiting Snooze and the choice of food was great! We ordered several items off the menu to test out and share. But we ended up ordering more! 

My favorite though was the coffee. The mugs they serve in kept the coffee warm forever!

If you want an incredibly sweet and savory breakfast, this is the place to go!!! My boyfriend and I shared the OMG French Toast and after the first bite, I said OMG this is SO good! We also shared the Sandwich I Am, which was a sausage, egg, and cheese sandwich on top of a pretzel bun. The servers were very nice and made sure our order was correct when we received our food. It was conveniently located right by ASU sports facilities, which we visited afterwards.

Go here!! If you haven't been, you're missing out. I wanted to lick my plate. I had the three pancakes and let me tell you...compliments to whoever created the menu...whew...I want some right now just thinking about it. Ok so I had the pineapple upside down pancake, the sweet potato and the blueberry streusel...yall...so damn tasty. Mimosas and other cocktails, great service, outside seating. I have nothing bad to say. I think we'll go there for breakfast tomorrow.

Food and drinks were absolutely incredible! Fun atmosphere and good pricing. Our waitress, Gloria, was extremely accommodating; couldn't have asked for better service. Will definitely return and request her in the future

Had breakfast with a group of friends today, and what a treat. Our servers, Jesse & Carleen were super attentive, cannot beat the customer service we received.  Travis greeted us and checked in several times to make sure all was good. The place was packed, but we  never felt rushed to order or eat. We must have timed it right, because there were no lines, but it did get completely filled.  The food was delicious, and definitely worth going back again. So many choices, and we did get to sample the pineapple pancakes, sweet potato pancake, and OMG French Toast. Will definitely go back and recommend to my friends.

The food is amazing and the indoor and out seating is good. The prices are a little bit high and the wait is normally long but the food is worth it. If you are in Tempe you need to try this place just make sure you bring change for the meter and bring a friend so they can sign in while you find parking.

I have visited a different location and enjoyed my experience there so I decided to give this one a try as it's closer than the one in Phoenix.

The Good
1. Friendly service 
2. Nice food and beverage selection including some lower calorie choices.
3. Reasonable prices 
4. Lots of outdoor seating 
5. Cheerful decor

The Meh

1. Can be a bit crowded 
2. Parking is hard to find, even in the parking structure that is not cheap
3. A little on the loud side 

I had the egg white frittata which was light and flavorful. I would definitely have it again!

Pretty cool place and consistently good food.

Anywhere I can eat a flight of something, is an automatic winner.  In this case, a Benny Duo in Spring Harvest and Chili Verdi.  Next time, the pancakes.  Thanks for having fabulous Faux options for my vegan buddy!

So happy that snooze has opened up within walking distance! I love this place... Sometimes the wait can be a little bit long but they have coffee for you to sip while you wait so I don't mind :) service has always been great and I haven't tried anything on the menu that I don't like yet.

This is my new favorite breakfast spot. The menu has such a wide variety of dishes to choose from. I had the pancake flight and it was absolutely delicious! Service was great, tasty food, fun atmosphere...what else could you possibly need? Yum! Will be back for sure!
Long wait but will be worth it. There is a ping pong table table here. Patio and inside are chill.

If I could give this place a 10, I would! This place was just phenomenal.. from the ambience.. really open and airy (if that even makes sense) it has a nice outdoor seating area and even a boche ball game for you to play.. to the friendly and fast service( despite the 30 min wait.. which let's fave it.. all good spots will have a wait) and the most important.. FOOD!

Now the food.. my god! The flavors in our meals.. were just the BOMB! I had some benedict.. with a green sauce, pico de gallo and tortillas..can't remember NAMES RIght now.. but let's just say I didn't leave one BIT behind! The mimosas were phenomenal.. not too much OJ and not too much bubbly(even tho I wouldn't have complained for that lol) overall the food was so good, that I can't wait to bring my NY friends here since were such brunchers out there lol

Went to Snooze Sat 10/17/18 at 8AM. Seated quickly, attentive service, good, hot coffee. Ordered the Eggs Benedict - Bella!Bella! Benny. Food came out quickly. Hollandaise sauce was tepid to COLD.

Return visit to Snooze Fri 10/23/15 at 9:30 AM. Busier - still seated quickly, all staff friendly, quick and efficient. Ordered Juan's Breakfast Tacos. Food came quickly. The hash browns in the tacos were hardly cooked - almost cold. The green chile hollandaise sauce was tepid to cold 

Are all the sauces here supposed to be served cold? 

The food would be awesome here, but what is the problem with food temperature? 

Great location, great atmosphere, awesome service, food LOOKS fantastic - Work on food temperature.

Service was great. I had the strawberry fields pancakes and found them very enjoyable. My wife had the pot pie that used filo dough. It was very good although it could have been served a little warmer. The menu here offers some unique items. It is a little pricey but that doesn't seem to bother the crowd. We are looking forward to Snooze AM opening up in Gilbert. Two things kept it from getting 5 stars from me... the pot pie could have been warmer and prices are a tad high. We were pleased with our serving sizes for both items we ordered.

We came for lunch, were seated and waited for 15 minutes with no drink orders nor any contact by the wait staff. We saw several standing around chatting with each other. We waived our arms and were ignored. We walked out.

Sweet or savory. No matter what you order from the menu, the food is delicious! Great staff with wonderful service. We drive out of our way to visit this Snooze location because we get treated by the manager, Travis.
pick two
brunch and beyond!
The food was amazing and the Breakfast Pot Pie was to die for. The mimosa's were not good though.. Way more juice that what we paid for. 8-9 dollars per glass.
Delicious all around! Celebrating my husband's bday while visiting from Chicago and this was a perfect spot for brunch! Food, drinks, service - all around wonderful. Thank you Snooze!

Best pancake I've ever had in my life. Every time I go I get the pancake of the day cause I know it won't disappoint! If you are looking for a good breakfast place in Tempe I highly encourage you to look no further. Snooze is everything!!

I finally decided to stop in and have breakfast here on a Sunday. I was not surprised by the wait and line once I arrived. I knew that this location is ALWAYS busy. Surprisingly, I got a table within ten minutes of checking in with my husband. Yay! Once we arrived at our table our waitress came to take our drink and breakfast order. Minutes later...our food was already delivered at our table. Talk about FAST! Our food came out so delicious. So delicious that I don't want to order anything else on the menu because I already fell in love with the first item I tried. I recommend coming early because they don't take reservations in advance, they're kind of a first come first serve type of restaurant. They're dog friendly. So, come and bring your pooches! If you're unable to find parking, the best option is to park at the nearby parking garage. Not many restaurants offer military discounts, but this Snooze location does!

Traveling for work (alone) so I avoided the long wait by sitting at the counter. Food was decent. Prices were reasonable. Service? Well, if two pretty girls hadn't sat next to me I might have gotten some attention. I wasn't asked if it was my first time there, wasn't offered the specials, and had to ask Steve for a place-setting. Had to wait for my check after leaving my credit card on the counter for nearly 10 minutes. He's capable of good service because he even gave these girls free pancakes! You'd think I was chopped liver or had a face covered in warts by how few times he even looked at me. Don't sit in his section and your experience might be better.

I skipped my way here to be honest. I saw a picture of the pancakes and knew that I had to have them. Upon arriving I sat at the bar with Adrienne, whom I adore. I ordered half of the Benny Goodman and half of the Winter Benny, both were amazing. Adrienne told me about their pancake of the day (which was Samoa) I didn't think I could eat all of that food, so I didn't order one. She was so sweet and sent out a small one to try on the house! The whole staff was helpful and super inviting. 


Side note they have amazing lattes (salted caramel was delish) and mimosas as well!
I hope you enjoy!

FOOD: I had pineapple upside down pancakes with a side of bacon. Wow. It exceeded my expectations. The pancakes had gooey pineapples mixed into the batter. It was finished with a generous drizzle of cream cheese frosting, and a pat of cinnamon butter on top.

My partner had the Cocoa Pancakes with a seared marshmallow on top, and a side of melted chocolate (in lieu of syrup). He loved it. He also ordered a beautuful side of fruit which looked fresh. 

DRINKS: I started with a cherry mimosa-like drink which was ok, but the Bloody Mary was very tasty. It had a nice amount of spice. He started with a grapefruit mimosa and finished with a different mixed drink that he appeared to enjoy.

SERVICE: Attentive, accurate, friendly, and prompt.

PARKING: A parking garage which is $3 an hour is just steps away. I don't know if weekends are always free, but it was free when we visited.

We dined during what, presumably, is one of their busiest periods (Sunday Brunch). Everything was spot-on. We're definitely going back!

Been meaning to write this since Sunday when we came in, just now getting a chance. I came in with my girlfriend and her sisters for the first time. We heard good things and wanted to try it out. I am not a university kid, I am a community college, rock n roll kid and I couldn't help but to scoff at some of the belligerent college bros stumbling out of some of the locations near by. No big deal, they need to have fun too I suppose! The wait was about 40 minutes, but the weather was nice and they gave us coffee. Some of the staff were nice, some seemed blah, but Kate (gosh I hope that is her name!) behind the bar was serving us and she was an A fucking + server. Best server I have had in probably years. Her suggestions were amazing, her knowledge about the food and drinks was ample and her smile was so contagious. Great service, nice mid century feel, and good food! The food was great, but not amazing (I know it is hard to do that with breakfast food) so Snooze gets 4 stars from me. If I could do 4.5, I would... Just cause the service was so good.

Our server was very attentive and explained everything very well and we only waited about 15 minutes.....they have done great flavors of pancakes....I enjoyed the pineapple upside down pancakes.....along with the corned beef hash.....a very nice stop....

I find this restaurant overrated and overhyped. They have cute decor and a nice patio but I think the atmosphere is better than the actual food. The mimosas were good, hard to screw that up, but our server was pretty aloof and  my sister had to literally flag him down to let him know he forgot to order hers. My dish was good not great, and my sisters (marscapone?) pancakes were way too sweet and rich.

I think there are way better brunch places in Tempe and you won't have to deal with paying for parking (they don't validate) or long waits.

If you love breakfast food, Snooze is the place for you. Familiar with their restaurants, I first visited one of the Snooze eateries in San Diego.  When I found out there was one in Tempe, I told my friends that we had to eat there while we were in town on a work trip.  Three of us showed up around 7:30am on a Sunday and there was no wait at all, but I didn't expect there to be that early which is why we showed up when we did.  From past experiences at the other Snooze I'd been to, I knew the place would be packed before too long, especially on a Sunday.  I knew I wanted a pancake flight for the variety. You can order any 3 flavors available for $9.75. I chose the Bourbon Street Pumpkin, Blueberry Danish, and Chocolate Chip. The guys both got the Breakfast Pot Pie with rosemary sausage gravy, puff pastry, egg, and hash browns.  After getting a taste of this, I wish I'd ordered it, too, because it was amazing!  Not that I was disappointed with my pancakes at all.  I especially liked the Blueberry Danish one.
My tip for Snooze is get there early or expect a wait and share your meal with your loved ones so you can try more good eats.
Great breakfast spot, reasonable prices and very good food. Really big portions, so choose carefully

If you are vegan the choices are limited. They do offer a tofu scramble that is very good. It is served with hashbrowns and toast. Other things on the menus that i saw was the porridge(i haven't tried that yet).

Delicious! My friend said sometimes there's a 2 hour wait and I see why! Such a large and creative selection not just the normal breakfast boring options. So many for anyone, picky eaters adventurous eaters, vegetarians! I got the Benny Goodman and it was good! My boyfriend got the burrito if you like leftovers this is for you because it was massive ! The selection of fresh mimosas is great and service is fast and friendly even when busy!

Had brunch here yesterday with my girlfriend, in from out of town. Honestly chose this place because of their yelp reviews and happy I did.  Super great food, really good drinks! Sat at the bar and Starchild helped us!
I recommend the Brewmossa and Eggs Benedict!

BACKGROUND 

There is no cooler place to eat pancakes in all of Phoenix than Snooze. 

SNOOZE AM EATERY: THE HISTORY 

Snooze has locations in Colorado, California and 4 in the Phoenix area (Camelback, College, Gilbert and Kierland). 

Every Snooze has the iconic super hype decor and edgy lighting. (see pics) 

And of course, their amazing menu which includes all sorts of yummy eggs and hollandaise specials, sandwiches and many sides,

BUT LET'S TALK ABOUT THE PANCAKES!!

Pineapple Upside Down Pancakes
Sweet Potato Pancakes 
Drunken Punk'n Pancakes
Blueberry Danish Pancakes 
Pancake of the Day
Chocolate Chip Pancakes 
Peanut Butter Cup Pancakes 

And my favorite:
Pancake Flight - which is where you can chose any 3 from above! (see pics)

And my next favorite:

The huge selection of breakfast cocktails: 
various mimosas, bloodys and mules. (see pics)

CONCLUSION 

This is the type of place you can eat at as many times as you want and never get bored. 

The service is always decent. 

Prices are very reasonable. 

5/5 RECOMMEND 

OF NOTE 

*Tip: Don't be surprised if you have to wait a bit for the morning rush on the weekends.

*Hours: 6:30am - 2:30pm Daily

*For more information:
SnoozeEatery.com

Took a trip to AZ for a baseball game (Go Dodgers) and one of the locals recommended this place... and OMG, this place is delicious! I want to go back to AZ just for their hash browns! Eggs were yummy too and the whole meal was inexpensive. My friends enjoyed their food too, including their mimosas. Ambiance is pretty chill. Nice, clean and great service.

Came here again as the manager of this location reached out to me and invited me back. 
My friend and I came in on a busy Friday morning. There was a long wait but we were able to grab a spot at one of the high top tables facing the window. I got the eggs Benedict the third, my favorite. I definitely appreciate that there are hooks underneath the table so you can hang your bag/purse. 
The customer service was much better this time around. If I'm in Tempe I'll definitely keep this Snooze location on my list for possible breakfast joints.
So - love this place, but definitely go to the Gilbert location.  Waitress was too busy to refill any drinks or check on us.  Not because the restaurant was busy, she was

Heard other tables complaining too.

Food was good, but not as good as the Gilbert location.  My son had the same meal - said it wasn't as good - but not bad.

Visited some friends in Chandler last week and came into this adorable diner for breakfast! We decided to sit at the bar and ordered cocktails and breakfast. You could tell the waitresses there really enjoyed their jobs! They let us sample the infused vodkas before ordering bloody marys, recommended some great menu items and they were incredibly attentive and friendly! I will definitely make a special trip over there when I go back to AZ. How about opening one up in Chicago?!?

I'm a Denver-ite, so I'm of course a huge Snooze fan/regular. I'm easily won over with decadent pancakes and incredibly boozy iced coffee.

Visited the Tempe location with a friend and was not disappointed. We got chilaquiles benedict, salsa verde benedict, OMG french toast & a PB cup pancake. For starters - WAY too much food for two people but, we're gluttons for punishment and breakfast foods so we stuffed ourselves into oblivion. The sweet eats are always my favorite - but the benedicts were damn good too. The chilaquiles was my favorite of the two.

Only downside is the wait times are almost always SO. LONG. But, that's a sign of a good place, no? We put in for two and were told about a 30-45 min wait, which is pretty standard around late Sunday brunch time. They serve coffee in the standing area while you wait though, so that's a nice occupier. However, if bar top seating comes open it's first come first serve and we scooped up two spots about 15 minutes into the wait. Scoooooore! It's also located on campus, so take that for what it's worth - we figured it would be filled with boozing college kids (because you know, we're SO old & far removed from that lifestyle in our late 20's ha!), but it wasn't at all an issue. 

Eat the pancake flight. Get the AM Manhattan. Then go home & take a nap.

Love this place. Their breakfast and coffee is so good. I really appreciate that they have coffee for those waiting to be seated as well. I haven't tried the drinks, but if hey are as good as the food and coffee, they must be great too. I highly recommend the breakfast burrito.

Very good breakfast. We didn't want to wait 20 minutes for a table so we grabbed a couple seats at the breakfast bar. The ham Benedict was delicious. The environment was fun, retro decor and lively colors.

By far the best was the Benny Goodman.

Lox style salmon and cream cheese served over toasted rye and topped with poached cage free eggs, cream cheese hollandaise blended with sun dried tomato and caper relish.

Another great item was the sweet potato pancake with caramel and pecans on top...Mmm..

Great find - cool spot by ASU (though the area was crawling with hipsters and basics - one dude in particular was trying waaaaayyyy too hard).

Anyway, cool retro-atomic interior (including coat/hat racks) - love it.

On to what's important.

Coffee - blah blah single source blah backpacking blah south america whatever - good coffee in a big mug with prompt refills - that's all that matters! 

We got a pretty good cross section of the breakfast menu among our party - a flight of pancakes (one blueberry, one sweet potato and one OMG French Toast - all very good, but the OMG French Toast was the winner), a Chilaquiles Benedict, another spicy Benedict, a combo of Sweet Potato pancake and OMG French Toast, a

My favorite place to have breakfast every time I'm in Tempe or Phoenix area. This place dishes out the classic breakfast dishes with their own twist! 

My usuals - Breakfast Pot Pie/Bella Bella Benedict/ Corned Beef Hash/O.M.G. French toast and always a side of tender bacon! 

Snooze also has great drink selections with a well crafted breakfast oriented cocktail menu. 

Also their pancakes are great, get the pancake flight and try the hot cocoa pancakes! 

Go early, as lines start to build on weekends.
Establishment is great to eat at. Service from every employee was outstanding. The food was quite refreshing and extremely flavorful.  Absolutely tube thumbs up no question about it.

Wonderful kind and personable service. There was a mix-up between the difference of a double shot and single shot but luckily it wasn't alcohol. The server and manager were quick to remedy the miscommunication. Usually we have to get our coffee from a coffee shop and food from somewhere else. This place has it all. Thank-you Snooze for the yummy brunch and strong coffee. We now can see our colors much more vividly.

Have seen this place several times when visiting the area, but it has always been closed. Happens that it's only breakfast til 2ish, but I'll be making frequent visits here. Def an add to the fav breakfast spots. 

Friendly staff, great ambiance, and delicious Eggs Benedict. Flavorful coffee and a nice Bloody Mary to get the Saturday started.
I think this is supposed to be warmer than this?

This is the best breakfast place I have eaten at in years. Nick was our waiter. 
We had Pineapple pancakes ...dual eggs Benedict, and the most awesome breakfast burrito.  The bloody Mary's were awesome also

They only offer two types of beer which is disappointing if you don't like breakfast type alcoholic beverages. I had French Toast Neat, which was disappointing, with a side of two scrambled eggs, which seemed like one in serving size, and it was all very overpriced. I won't be coming back. Perhaps I will try Postino next door for brunch next time.

I've been wanting to go to Snooze for months, but they get so busy on weekends! I begged my husband to get up by 7am so we could head there early. We arrived with plenty of open tables. I had the pancake flight - pumpkin, sweet potato, chocolate peanut butter cup, and my husband had the corned beef hash. I also had a mimosa with orange juice and the dirty drunken chai. I was drunk before 8am. :D The food was fantastic, staff is super friendly, and I love the ambiance. I can't wait to go back!

The food here is wonderful! Fresh pico and affordable breakfast alcohol! I recommend the brewmosa! The server we had, Sophie was the best! She was always there to help and was very genuine with her conversations. If you are in town you should go because it has a beautiful view of A mountain!

I've eaten here a number of times since it opened and found the service to be great and the belly bacon always delicious. The one thing that always bugged me though is I've always hated the hash browns molded into a tour. Well today, while doing breakfast with some friends, the waiter let us know we could get the hash browns mashed down and fried crispy. i didn't get any but some of my friends did and they are everything a breakfast hash brown should be, flattened out and crispy all over. I asked if this was a new thing and the wait person told me no, it was always available and not listed so you have to ask for it.

Well Snooze, knowing that I can get my hash browns the way I want them kicks you up a star. In addition, it was my first time eating at the outside tables and wow, it was so nice outside, what a great way to start the day.

This is a ASU favorite  I went for the first time while moving my daughter back to ASU.  Had the pineapple upside pancakes, and WOW what an explosion of flavor.  Its a must to return.  Try it you wont regret it

Went here for the first time and the food was very good to excellent, although sadly I have to knock off a couple of stars due to some poor customer service which I'll get to in a bit. 

First the good, I had the corned beef hash which was very tasty and so much better then the standard hash you get from most breakfast places. At the table we also had eggs benedict which were great, and the french toast was some of the best I've ever had. The coffee was above average for a breakfast place, and the prices overall were reasonable. The juices tasted freshly squeezed the overall quality of the food was great.

Apparently there is often an hour wait when ASU is in session, but with school out the wait was only 10 minutes or so.

Now to the aforementioned downside. My partner ordered some chorizo along with his breakfast. When we got the bill he was charged double the amount listed on the menu. When he brought it up to the waitress she got the manager who pointed out a section on the back part of the menu where the same item was shown with the increased price, then attempted to explain why sometimes it costs more and sometimes it cost less. When he pointed out there was nothing on the menu to indicate one vs the other we got a big eye-roll, shrug and the manager left without another word. It was only a difference of a couple dollars on a 60 dollar tab and an easy fix for the manager but the blow off left us annoyed and unlikely to come back, despite the quality of the food.

Another gem that Yelp led me to.  Saw the ratings and decided to check this place out...a hipster, cool breakfast joint with amazing menu choices and great atmosphere.  I had the Hashbrown plate, topped with 2 sunny-side up eggs and added hickory sausage gravy and bacon.  Now if you are a
game day
bourbon
breakfast nook

Wow.  So my husband picked this place for the good-looking menu and because he and my son LOVE breakfast.  I'm more of a lunch person, but I'm a convert!  The service was EXCELLENT!  To start the culinary ecstasy we tried a cinnamon roll pancake with candied pecans and cinnamon butter...holy cow!  The pancake was the perfect texture, super hot and the whole combo was the best pancake I've ever had.  My husband doesn't care for pancakes and he was blown away.  My son had the pineapple upside-down pancake and it was insanely awesome!  I had the breakfast tacos with the most delicious green chili hollandaise sauce topped with fresh cilantro and bacon...made me a breakfast believer!  My husband had the Cuban breakfast sandwich that was everything he wanted and more!  We are driving, so couldn't experience the bar drinks, but definitely will next trip.  Great coffee drinks and the whole vibe of this place was friendly, customer-oriented and amazing!  Can't wait to come back!   Well worth a trip!

My son was in town visiting us with his girlfriend. They wanted to go somewhere for breakfast after I picked them up from the airport. I thought this place, located in Kierland would be the perfect spot. It was a little cold to sit on the patio - however they do have patio heaters which were nice. It was a Saturday morning and our wait wasn't too bad. They told us it would be about 30 minutes, but it was really only 20!  We had breakfast tacos and pancakes. Everything was yummy!  They brought a sample of their pancake of the day with their homemade cinnamon sauce. I could have eaten only that!  Next time I guess. Great food, great ambiance and friendly staff!

Excellent chow, friendly/efficient service, bright and airy setting make for a worthy breakfast experience.

Place was busy on a Friday at 830: 10 minute wait on a table.  We opted for the counter, where the service was attentive, even though our server Tori was filling drink orders non-stop. She made sure we got everything we needed, and she topped it off w/ some tasty beverages, my BMary included.

I had scrambled eggs, hash browns and sausage pattie. Menu says 3 eggs, though the serving looked more like 2. Hash browns were tasty, but not as crispy as iike them, and the sausage was alright.  I added pico de gallo to my plate, and it balanced the flavors for me instantly. The rest of the family enjoyed their breakfasts, the pancakes and bfast tacos very well received, and we all left satisfied. I'll return!

Cheers!
RS

Was in yesterday for brunch and am super dissapointed. I ordered the corned beef hash and what came out was a thin layer of burnt hashbrowns with an almost undetectable amount of hash. I expressed my concern to the server and she told me they were working on the recipe and would bring me out another side of hash. It came out about 10 mins later and was much better than what I originally recieved. I was charged for both my meal and the side which ended up costing over 15 dollars. I've been in the food service industry for 6 years and believe this situation was handled improperly. Definitly won't be returning and will be advising everyone to do the same.
I hate giving only 1 star but my family just had a horrible experience there!!!! Great food but the service is absolutely terrible so we didn't even get a chance to eat. A

turned into over an hour before our name was called to even get a seat. Just left the restaurant annoyed. They were giving other people's tables away to the wrong groups, customers were very frustrated this morning. Would only consider this place during the summer when they can handle the little incoming demand. Absolutely ridiculous.

The food here is always awesome but my review is regarding the service that was provided. We came on a Sunday morning so of course, it was busy. The hostess told me it would be about 20-25 minutes but we only waited for 5 mintues which was a great. When we sat down, our awesome waitress, Kylie, took our order. Kylie was nothing short of a great person in general but also the best waitress we've ever had. She was ontop of everything and had a great personality. My family and i agreed that we will now always request her as our waitress! So to the manager of Snooze, you should definitely offer a life time supply of pinnaple pancakes and a beer on the house for Kylie for her exceptional service!

I've tried getting into this Snooze a few times but the trick is to come here super early on the weekends and there won't be a wait. We showed up around 9am and there was a line out the door. My friend is in a wheelchair and it was next to impossible to maneuver her around the crowded tables of people without disrupting their meal. I had the sweet potato pancakes and it was not at all what I was expecting. I decided to try their regular pancakes and they also fell flat. 
My friend had the break pot-pie but the eggs seemed way too gooey for my taste. I guess I will pass on Snooze from now on and just go next door.

Can you say overrated? Why people eat here will always puzzle me. I would rather go to Denny's because at least their food comes out warm and the hash browns have some flavor. Tried this place twice now and will not return.

This place was absolutely delicious! The staff were all so friendly and appeared happy! I had the corned beef and it's the best Ive had! Not to mention the pineapple upside down cake pancakes!! Even bought a pack of their coffee to go! Can't wait to eat here again next time I'm in the area!

One the best breakfasts I've had. The service was great; everyone was helping out each other so a drink was never empty! Lizzie was great in offering advice and seemed very knowledgeable on the menu. She was also very honest on her suggestions which I appreciate. I hate the

response.

I had a half order of the corned beef hash and the half and half eggs Benedict. You're able to order two Benedict's which was perfect for me. The steak and eggs benny is by far the best thing I ate. Perfect seasoning, texture and the steak was cooked perfect! Also got the avocado smash Benny which was also delicious. My wife got a giant burrito smothered in green chili and loved it. My kids both got the French toast house and cleaned their plates. This is our new favorite spot!!

So so so good! Best breakfast with a fun environment in Tempe. We have been there multiple times and enjoy it every time. Always enjoy there pancake flights :) so yummy! 
There is a long wait if you go on the weekends so plan ahead for that. 
Service is always nice and friendly. The even gave us free pancakes once :)

By far my favorite spot for breakfast!! I had the Caprese Benedict which was amazingly delicious!  That plate had ripe heirloom tomatoes tossed with pesto, served over mozzarella. It also comes with 2 poached eggs (caged free eggs) with cream cheese hollandaise on top of crispy toast. I'll definitely come back again to try more items on the menu.
So delicious! I always go to a Snooze when there is one in the row I'm staying at. Loved the pancake flight!

My friend and I went to breakfast here today. I know they're packed on the weekend, but during the week it's almost empty first thing in the morning. 

I had the OMG French toast. It was dessert for breakfast: French toast with mascarpone, caramel sauce, and strawberries. My dining partner had the breakfast pot pie - it looked delicious. 

Our coffee cups were always full. Our server was attentive but not overbearing.

I may not be back on the weekend because of how busy it gets, but I'll be back.

Wowzers! Pineapple Upside Down pancake is out of this world yummy. Perfectly poached eggs. Crispy hash browns upon request. Bloody Mary ...mmmm good. Good service. The food was so good I went back again a couple days later while in town and brought a friend.

We came here for a Sunday brunch and decided to share something sweet apart to having our Benedict eggs. We wanted pancakes but then something on the menu called our attention: the O.M.G. French toasts. We decided to give it a try, admittedly a bit skeptical. We were blown away and we were constantly mumbling

!
We had to come again the next day before leaving Phoenix back home. This time I wanted the full order for myself so I didn't  have to share it!  
I would give it 5 stars because of the OMG French toasts, the Benedicts were great and tasty. The MMM mimosa was great too. The service is great and friendly. However, my only complaint was that I ordered an OJ and asked the waiter whether it was freshly squeezed OJ, he said that it was, but when I tried it, it tasted like tropicana orange juice, which is good but not what I wanted or had in mind.
